newsitem.title: USA: Fuji to make 35 mm film at U.S. plant.
newsitem.headline: Fuji to make 35 mm film at U.S. plant.

text.p: Fuji Photo Film Inc said Thursday it plans to spend $200 million and add 100 jobs to expand its plant in South Carolina so it can begin manufacturing 35mm film in the United States.
U.S. customers would begin receiving 35mm color film manufactured entirely in the U.S. by the end of 1997.
Its Greenwood, S.C., plant is to have an initial capacity to produce 100 million rolls annually, Fuji said.

The company said it also plans to expand the manufacturing capacity of its color photographic paper factory in Greenwood, increasing production to about 1.6 billion square feet annually, or about 50 percent more than existing capacity.
Fuji Photo Film Inc was established in Greenwood in 1988 and serves as Fujifilm's North American manufacturing headquarters. It is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Fuji Photo Film Co Ltd.
